qas.question: What were the reaches of the Ptolemaic Kingdom?

answers.text: Syria in the east, to Cyrene to the west, and south to the frontier with Nubia

qas.question: What was the capital in the Prolemaic Kingdom?
What were leaders known as during Ptolemaic Kingdom?
What religious life was the Ptolemaic Kingdom?

context: The Ptolemaic Kingdom was a powerful Hellenistic state, extending from southern <a0_0>Syria in the east, to Cyrene to the west, and south to the frontier with Nubia<a0_0/>. <a1_0>Alexandria<a1_0/> became the capital city and a centre of Greek culture and trade. To gain recognition by the native Egyptian populace, they named themselves as the successors to the <a2_0>Pharaohs<a2_0/>. The later Ptolemies took on Egyptian traditions, had themselves portrayed on public monuments in Egyptian style and dress, and participated in <a3_0>Egyptian<a3_0/> religious life.
